channel.title: Teaching on Pratheepa Jeganathan
channel.description: Recent content in Teaching on Pratheepa Jeganathan

item.title: STATS 191 (Autumn 2019, Stanford)
item.description: Description Syllabus Course Overview Expected outcomes Course Information Prerequisites Textbook Software Evaluation Policies Lecture Notes Course Schedule Important Dates R Markdown files Description Course link. Syllabus Course Overview Statistical tools for modern data analysis. Topics include regression and prediction, elements of the analysis of variance, bootstrap, and cross-validation. Emphasis is on conceptual rather than theoretical understanding. Student assignments require use of the software package R.

item.title: STATS 205 (Spring 2019, Stanford)
item.description: Description Syllabus Course Overview Expected outcomes Course Information Prerequisites Texts Other sources Software Grading Lecture Notes Course Schedule R Markdown files Description Course link. Syllabus Course Overview This course covers nonparametric analogs of the one- and two-sample t-tests and analysis of variance; the sign test, median test, Wilcoxonâ€™s tests, and the Kruskal-Wallis and Friedman tests, tests of independence; nonparametric regression and nonparametric density estimation; modern nonparametric techniques; nonparametric confidence interval estimates.
